projects.name: Hoverloon
projects.tagline: Hybrid blimp-drone platform achieving 19x payload capacity through buoyant lift
projects.summary: Hoverloon is a novel hybrid aerial vehicle that combines lighter-than-air buoyancy with quadcopter control to dramatically improve payload capacity and flight endurance. By using helium for lift and electric motors only for maneuvering, the system achieved 19x payload capacity compared to a traditional drone alone, enabling applications requiring extended flight time.

problemStatement.problem: Traditional multirotor drones have severely limited flight time (typically 20-30 minutes) and payload capacity because they must constantly expend energy fighting gravity. This makes them unsuitable for applications requiring extended operation, such as environmental monitoring, infrastructure inspection, or telecommunications relay.
constraints: Battery energy density limits flight time to under 30 minutes for most drones
Payload capacity inversely related to flight time
Scaling up drone size increases weight faster than lift capacity
Energy efficiency fundamentally limited by constantly fighting gravity
existingSolutions: Fixed-wing aircraft: Better endurance but require forward motion, can't hover
Large multirotor drones: Poor energy efficiency, expensive
Traditional blimps: Difficult to control, bulky, slow response
Tethered drones: Unlimited flight time but severely limited mobility
problemStatement.opportunity: Hybrid approach combining buoyancy for lift with electric propulsion for control could achieve superior performance to any single approach

solution.approach: Integrate helium-filled envelope for buoyancy with quadcopter-style propulsion for 3D control. The buoyancy provides passive lift, while electric motors enable precise positioning, station-keeping, and maneuvering.
keyInnovations: Lightweight structural design minimizing parasitic weight while maintaining rigidity
Adaptive control algorithms handling variable buoyancy with altitude and temperature changes
Computer vision-based positioning system optimized for low-power operation
Novel envelope design balancing lift capacity with aerodynamic efficiency
Integration of buoyant lift with vectored thrust for full 6-DOF control

technicalApproach.buoyancy: Helium-filled envelope sized to provide ~90% of total lift for vehicle + payload
technicalApproach.propulsion: Quadcopter motor configuration for roll, pitch, yaw, and vertical control
technicalApproach.control: ROS-based control system with computer vision for positioning and autonomous navigation
technicalApproach.power: Lithium polymer batteries sized for 2+ hour operation with station-keeping
technicalApproach.sensors: Camera for vision-based positioning, IMU for attitude estimation, ultrasonic for altitude

solution.designPhilosophy: Minimize weight everywhere to maximize payload capacity. Use buoyancy to handle the majority of lift, reserving motor power for control and maneuvering. Optimize for station-keeping rather than speed.

activities: CAD modeling of envelope and structural components
Motor and propeller selection based on control requirements
Motor mount and structural frame construction
Electronics integration (flight controller, sensors, power system)
Indoor flight testing and control tuning
Flight time and energy efficiency testing

quantitative.projectedDuration: 6-12 hours with improved envelope and optimization
quantitative.energySavings: ~90% reduction in power consumption for station-keeping vs. traditional drone

qualitative: Demonstrated viability of hybrid blimp-drone approach
Achieved stable station-keeping in indoor environment
Proof-of-concept for extended-duration aerial monitoring applications

challenges.description: Helium is extremely small and leaks through most materials. Finding lightweight materials with low permeability was critical.
challenges.solution: Used specialized barrier films and careful sealing techniques. Designed for semi-permanent flight with minimal helium top-ups.

challenges.description: Buoyancy varies with altitude and temperature, requiring adaptive control. Traditional quadcopter control algorithms needed modification.
challenges.solution: Developed adaptive control system that estimates and compensates for buoyancy changes in real-time.

challenges.description: GPS unavailable indoors, requiring alternative positioning method.
challenges.solution: Computer vision-based positioning using ceiling-mounted cameras and markers, optimized for low computational overhead.

challenges.description: Needed rigid structure for motor mounts while minimizing weight.
challenges.solution: Iterative CAD design with lightweight materials (carbon fiber, foam) strategically placed for maximum rigidity-to-weight ratio.

learnings: Hybrid systems can achieve order-of-magnitude improvements by combining complementary approaches
Weight optimization is critical for aerial vehicles - every gram matters
Computer vision can enable robust positioning without GPS in many applications
Buoyancy provides essentially 'free' lift but introduces new control challenges
Real-world testing reveals issues invisible in simulation - importance of iterative prototyping
Multi-disciplinary projects require understanding aerodynamics, control theory, computer vision, and mechanical design

applications.description: Extended flight time enables continuous air quality monitoring, temperature sensing, or wildlife observation
Stable hovering and long endurance ideal for inspecting bridges, buildings, power lines
Large payload capacity can carry LiDAR or other mapping sensors for warehouse or building mapping
Could serve as temporary communications node for emergency response or events
Extended flight enables monitoring large agricultural areas for crop health or irrigation

projects.impact: Demonstrated that hybrid aerial vehicles can achieve performance impossible with single-approach designs. The 19x payload improvement opens possibilities for applications previously infeasible with traditional drones. Project contributed to Princeton Robotics Club's reputation and inspired further research into hybrid aerial systems.
futureDirections: Outdoor flight testing and GPS-based navigation
Improved envelope materials for longer helium retention
Integration of additional sensors (LiDAR, gas sensors)
projects.documentation: Internal Princeton Robotics Club documentation and demonstration videos

projects.name: Building Humanoid Robots
projects.tagline: Making robots real through teleoperation and embodied AI
projects.summary: Building humanoid robots equipped with SO-100 robotic arms, exploring teleoperation as a fast, intuitive (System 1) procedure to enable better data collection for training autonomous behaviors. The goal is to advance humanoid robotics by creating practical human-robot interfaces and collecting high-quality training data for embodied AI.

problemStatement.problem: Humanoid robots remain largely confined to research labs because: (1) autonomous control of complex manipulation tasks is extremely difficult, (2) collecting training data for learning-based approaches is time-consuming and expensive, and (3) teleoperation interfaces are often clunky and unintuitive.
challenges: Autonomous manipulation requires huge amounts of training data
Traditional data collection (kinesthetic teaching, scripting) is slow
Existing teleoperation interfaces have steep learning curves
Sim-to-real transfer for manipulation remains difficult
Most robotics research focuses on narrow task domains
problemStatement.opportunity: Intuitive teleoperation could serve as both a practical control method AND a data generation pipeline for learning autonomous behaviors

solution.approach: Treat teleoperation not just as a control method, but as a 'System 1' (fast, intuitive) procedure that enables humans to naturally demonstrate complex tasks. Record these demonstrations to build datasets for training autonomous policies.
keyIdeas: Design teleoperation interface for maximum intuitiveness - goal is immediate usability without extensive training
Record all teleoperation sessions as demonstration data for imitation learning
Focus on practical tasks that have real-world value
Iterate on both hardware and interface based on user experience
Build toward hybrid autonomy where robot can learn from corrections

technicalApproach.hardware: SO-100 robotic arms chosen for good dexterity and reasonable cost
technicalApproach.control: C++ control stack with ROS for modular architecture
technicalApproach.teleoperation: Exploring multiple interface modalities (VR, motion capture, direct manipulation)
technicalApproach.data: Comprehensive logging of joint states, end-effector poses, forces, camera feeds
technicalApproach.learning: Collected data usable for behavior cloning, imitation learning, or RL

currentProgress: Assembled humanoid robot system with SO-100 arms
Developing data collection pipeline and logging infrastructure
Testing different interaction paradigms for operator ease-of-use
Building toward first practical demonstrations (object manipulation, tool use)

challenges.approach: Iterating on multiple interface modalities to find most natural mapping between human input and robot motion
Optimizing control loop and communication to minimize delay between operator input and robot response
Dealing with practical issues of robot assembly, calibration, maintenance
Ensuring collected demonstrations are clean, consistent, and useful for learning

projects.motivation: Driven by desire to 'make robots real' - move from research prototypes to practical, deployable systems. Believe that better data collection through intuitive teleoperation is key to unlocking embodied AI. Interested in the intersection of human-robot interaction and machine learning.
learnings: Teleoperation interface design is critically important and often underestimated
Hardware reliability matters immensely for practical robotics
Good data is more valuable than sophisticated learning algorithms
Real-world robotics involves constant iteration and problem-solving
Human demonstration quality varies - interface must make it easy to do well
futureDirections: Train first autonomous policies from collected demonstration data
Expand to more complex manipulation tasks
Implement hybrid control (autonomy with human corrections)
Build larger dataset spanning diverse tasks
Share learnings and potentially open-source tooling
projects.impact: Contributing to advancement of practical humanoid robotics. Exploring whether better teleoperation can accelerate progress in embodied AI by enabling more efficient data collection.
projects.philosophy: Robots should be accessible and practical, not just research curiosities. The path to general-purpose robots likely involves human demonstration and guidance, not just pure autonomy from day one.

projects.name: LastCurb
projects.tagline: Edge AI for smart parking in NYC
projects.summary: Computer vision system that analyzes curb data from public NYC CCTV cameras to detect available parking spots in real-time. Built to explore edge AI deployment and real-time machine learning for urban sensing applications.

problemStatement.problem: Finding parking in NYC is notoriously difficult and time-consuming. Drivers circle searching for spots, contributing to traffic congestion and wasted time. Existing parking apps rely on manual reporting or payment data, which is often stale or incomplete.
quantification: Average driver spends 17 hours per year searching for parking (US average)
30% of city traffic congestion caused by drivers searching for parking
NYC has thousands of public CCTV cameras with unused data
problemStatement.opportunity: Public CCTV cameras already monitor many curbs. Computer vision could automatically detect parking availability in real-time.

solution.approach: Deploy edge AI computer vision models to analyze public CCTV feeds, detecting cars and determining which curb spaces are occupied vs. available. Process video feeds in real-time on edge devices to minimize latency and bandwidth.

technicalApproach.vision: Object detection models (YOLO-based) to identify vehicles
technicalApproach.tracking: Multi-object tracking to associate detections across frames
technicalApproach.mapping: Spatial mapping to associate vehicle detections with specific parking zones
technicalApproach.edge: Model optimization for edge deployment (quantization, pruning)
technicalApproach.pipeline: Video ingestion → detection → tracking → availability determination → update

designDecisions: Edge deployment to minimize latency and cloud costs
Focus on accuracy over speed (30-second latency acceptable for parking)
Privacy-preserving (no license plate recognition, no data retention)
Modular architecture allowing different models/detectors to be swapped

stack.ml: PyTorch/TensorFlow for model training, ONNX for deployment
stack.vision: OpenCV for video processing and manipulation
stack.deployment: Edge devices (Raspberry Pi or similar) at camera locations
stack.backend: Lightweight server for aggregating availability data

modelDevelopment: Started with pre-trained object detection model (YOLOv5/v8)
Fine-tuned on NYC street scenes and parking scenarios
Optimized model size and inference speed for edge deployment
Implemented confidence thresholding and filtering for robustness

challenges.description: Running computer vision models on resource-limited edge hardware
challenges.solution: Model optimization (quantization, pruning), frame subsampling, batching

challenges.description: CCTV cameras have diverse mounting positions, angles, and lighting conditions
challenges.solution: Data augmentation during training, perspective calibration, adaptive thresholds

challenges.description: Cars may be partially occluded by other vehicles or objects
challenges.solution: Temporal tracking to handle brief occlusions, spatial reasoning about parking zones

challenges.description: Need to process video feeds with minimal latency
challenges.solution: Optimized inference pipeline, async processing, strategic frame sampling

technical: Achieved real-time parking detection (updates every 30-60 seconds)
~85-90% accuracy in detecting occupied vs. available spaces
Successfully deployed on edge hardware with <2W power consumption
Demonstrated viability of edge AI for urban sensing
learnings: Edge AI is feasible for many real-time vision tasks
Model optimization critical for deployment on resource-constrained devices
Real-world vision systems must handle huge variety of conditions
Good data preprocessing and calibration improve robustness significantly

applications: Urban planning data on parking utilization
Traffic optimization through reduced search time
projects.impact: Demonstrated practical application of edge AI for urban problems. Showed that existing camera infrastructure can be repurposed for smart city applications. Open-sourced for community use and further development.
learnings: Edge AI enables privacy-preserving local processing
Computer vision systems must be robust to real-world variability
Urban sensing applications require careful calibration and testing
Good enough is often sufficient - perfect accuracy unnecessary for many use cases

projects.name: Leveraged BTC Funding Rate Carry Strategy
projects.tagline: Delta-neutral crypto arbitrage harvesting perpetual funding rate premium
projects.summary: Delta-neutral quantitative trading strategy that harvests perpetual funding rate carry in cryptocurrency markets with leverage while hedging away directional market risk. The strategy exploits the basis between spot and futures markets, generating returns uncorrelated with Bitcoin's price movements.

problemStatement.background: In cryptocurrency futures markets, perpetual futures contracts use a 'funding rate' mechanism to keep futures prices anchored to spot prices. When futures trade above spot (contango), longs pay shorts a periodic fee. When futures trade below spot (backwardation), shorts pay longs.
problemStatement.observation: Funding rates in crypto markets are often persistently positive (averaging 10-50% APR historically), creating an opportunity to collect these payments by shorting futures while hedging the directional risk.
problemStatement.challenge: How to harvest funding rate premium while remaining market-neutral and managing risks of leverage, liquidation, and basis divergence?

solution.strategy: Establish delta-neutral position by holding equal notional value of long spot BTC and short perpetual futures contracts. Profit from funding rate payments while remaining neutral to BTC price movements.

mechanism.longSpot: Purchase BTC on spot market (e.g., Coinbase, Binance spot)
mechanism.shortFutures: Short equal notional value of BTC perpetual futures (e.g., Binance futures)
mechanism.funding: Collect funding rate payments every 8 hours when futures are in contango
mechanism.hedge: Position remains delta-neutral - profit/loss from spot and futures offset
mechanism.leverage: Use leverage on futures side to amplify returns from relatively small funding rates

riskManagement: Position sizing to avoid liquidation even in extreme price moves
Monitoring and rebalancing to maintain delta neutrality
Funding rate monitoring to avoid periods of negative funding

technologies.programming: Python for strategy execution and backtesting
technologies.apis: Exchange APIs (Binance, FTX, others) for order execution
technologies.data: Historical price and funding rate data for backtesting
technologies.monitoring: Real-time position and P&L monitoring dashboards

components: Live execution system with API integration
development: Research phase: analysis of funding rate dynamics and profitability
Paper trading: simulation with live market data
Live deployment: execution with real capital (small initial size)
Optimization: parameter tuning and risk management refinement

theoretical: Historical average funding rate ~20-40% APR in bull markets
With 2x leverage, effective return ~40-80% APR on capital
Returns uncorrelated with BTC price direction
practical: Successfully implemented and tested strategy with live capital
Achieved positive returns during test period
Learned about practical execution challenges (slippage, fees, rebalancing)
research: Published academic paper on SSRN documenting strategy and findings
Contributed to understanding of crypto market microstructure

challenges.description: Using leverage on futures side creates liquidation risk if BTC moves strongly
challenges.solution: Conservative position sizing, maintain margin buffer, automatic rebalancing

challenges.description: Risk of exchange insolvency or technical issues
challenges.solution: Diversify across multiple exchanges, withdraw excess funds regularly

challenges.description: Spot and futures prices may diverge temporarily
challenges.solution: Accept short-term basis risk as it's mean-reverting, size positions appropriately

challenges.description: Market orders incur slippage, limit orders may not fill
challenges.solution: Optimize order placement, use limit orders when possible, account for realistic slippage in backtests

learnings: Crypto market microstructure differs significantly from traditional markets
Funding rates reflect market sentiment and leverage demand
Delta-neutral strategies still have risks (basis, liquidation, counterparty)
Live trading always reveals issues not apparent in backtesting
Risk management is paramount - size positions conservatively
Market conditions change - strategies must be monitored and adapted
concepts: Perpetual futures mechanics and funding rates
projects.impact: Demonstrated that systematic, market-neutral strategies can generate returns in crypto markets. Research contributed to academic literature on crypto derivatives. Open-source implementation provides educational resource for others interested in quantitative crypto trading.

paper.title: Leveraged Bitcoin Funding Rate Carry Research

common: Building practical solutions to real-world problems
Achieving order-of-magnitude improvements through novel approaches
Focus on shipping and demonstrating working systems
technicalPatterns: Comfort with hardware and software integration
Pragmatic trade-offs between ideal and practical
